result.execSummary:
The defendant Stuart J Schwartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges
 (including 75% drug abuse surcharge if applicable)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores except as necessary for employment purposes
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes and at SALS house or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise as deemed appropriate per Agent

Arresting Agency: JCSD

Court finds that society will not be harmed, that the Defendant will benefit and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation.

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Schwartz  to 30 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 15 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  15 months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stuart J Schwartz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court's Remarks on Third Party Letter; copied to Attys

ADDRESS INFO for Stuart J Schwartz
Current: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0700 United States  (Effective: 12-19-2016)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Copy of letter from third party to DA Happ re: Sentencing

Case called at 9:02am [ma]
Defendant Stuart J Schwartz in court, in custody with Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Revocation Order and Warrant:
--no factual corrections by Counsel

recess: 9:04am--reconvene: 9:22am (to allow DA Happ to read Defense's sentencing memorandum)

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
Peggy Schwartz makes a statement
Brooke Hobbs makes a statement 
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Ehrfurth

The Court and Counsel discuss Wis. Stat. 961.47 and 961.475
Statement made by Defendant

The Court sentences Mr. Schwartz  to 30 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 15 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  15 months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH  

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  225   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to pay any outstanding costs, fees, surcharges
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--take all prescriptions as presribed
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--undergo randon drug and/or alcohol screening
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant


recess: 10:30am

Order to Produce defendant - SAR - 12-01-16

cc: Cert. copy to DA by COC on 11/23/16. sf
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
It is hereby ordered that Christopher Ehrfurth is substituted as the attorney of record for the defendant, Stuart J. Schwartz
Stipulation and Proposed Order for Substitution of Attorney
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Revocation Order and Warrant received from DOC
from treatment provider submitted by Attorney Maastantuono at plea and sentencing hearing

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with elements and criminal case settlement

Case called at 11:10 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Stuart J Schwartz in court with Attorney Craig Mastantuono. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Mastanuono submits plea paperwork along with supplemental letter from treatment provider
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Schwartz waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived--maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores except as necessary for employment purposes
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges (including 75% drug abuse surcharge if applicable)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $75 drug testing fee
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes and at SALS house or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise as deemed appropriate per Agent

No suspension of driving privileges
Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court finds that society will not be harmed, that the Defendant will benefit and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation
Recess: 11:47 am
Letters submitted by defense counsel ref plea/sent hearing

Case called at 2:41pm [mo]
Defendant Stuart J Schwartz in court with Attorney Craig Mastantuono.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Mastantuono gives update at to Mr. Schwartz's treatment and current residence; further requests a Plea and Sentencing date out 6 weeks to allow for completion of treatment
--No objection from the State

Atty. Mastantuono indicates that Mr. Schwart'z Helenville address remains current for mailing.
recess: 2:44pm

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing: 9/24/2015 at 2:00pm

Case called at 11:18am [mo]
Defendant Stuart J Schwartz in court with Attorney Craig Mastantuono.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Mastantuono requests a plea and sentencing out 90 days to allow Mr. Schwartz to complete additional treatment.
DA Happ suggests a Status Conference in 30 days, without the required attendance of Mr. Schwartz if he is in a residential treatment program.
Atty. Mastantuono is to satisfy the State that Mr. Schwartz is in residential treatement and therefore does not need to attend the status conference; shall the Defense satisfy the State's request then Atty. Mastantuono is to notify the court of Mr. Schwartz's non- appearance. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheudling.
Ther Court reminds Mr. Schwartz that his bond and its conditions remain in effect.
recess:11:27am 

NEXT: Status Conference---July 30, 2015 at 2:30pm
Proposed STAO for continuance of the 6/9/15 STC
No action taken on proposed stip and order submitted on 04-29-15
Status conference on June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 29, 2015 at 10:40 am.
Defendant endorsed the bond on 4/9/15, COC received the bond back from JCSD on 4/10/15

case called at 1:35-pm. 
Defendant Stuart J Schwartz appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yalena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Zarwell indicates that Mr. Schwartz is eligible for PD appointment
The Court confirms Mr. Schwartz address on file 

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's Dept. 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, without a valid prescription, including needles
--any controlled substance taken has to be taken consistent with the prescription
recess 1:41 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/29/15 at 10:40   (2) Status Conference: 6/9/15 at 8:30am
